author: Madurai Bureau
text:
As part of massive planting of 68 lakh saplings all over the State, a campaign to plant 2.12 lakh saplings in Virudhunagar district was inaugurated by Revenue Minister R. B. Udhayakumar at Sattur government hospital on Monday.

The Minister, in his speech, said that 64 lakh saplings had been planted in 2012, followed by 65 lakh in 2013, 66 lakh in 2014, and 67 lakh saplings in 2015 all over the State. They had been planted in educational institutions, office complexes and along roads.Ramanathapuram

Minister for Sports and Youth Welfare S. Sundararaj launched the campaign at Lakshmipuram Oorani near Ramanathapuram on Monday. The Forest Department plans to plant 2.19 lakh saplings in the district this year.

The Minister said that since the sapling planting programme was launched in 2011-12, 6.95 lakh saplings had been planted in more than 1,000 sites. During 2015-16, 2.09 lakh saplings were planted at 183 places, he said. The district administration and the forest department worked together in greening the Rameswaram-Dhanushkodi National Highway, schools, colleges, waterbodies, he said. District Forest Officer M. Pitchai said that about 2.19 lakh saplings would be planted during 2016-17. As many as 25,800 saplings would be planted in the reserve forests, he said. The Forest Department would raise nurseries at Thangachimadam, Mariyur, Kamudhakudi and Aartangarai areas.
title: Saplings planting campaign begins
